metadata.dc:author: Ballesteros Llompart, Jesús
metadata.dc:description: Monotheism has historically encouraged science, in so far as it considers the world as a God's creation at the service of human beings. Nowadays, monotheism finds itself opposing the developments of techno-science, which all too readily transforms humans into mere instruments.
metadata.dc:title: La Religión, ¿Freno o motor de la Ciencia?
[Religion: obstacle or impulse for science?].
metadata.dc:publisher: Cuadernos de bioetica : revista oficial de la Asociacion Espanola de Bioetica y Etica Medica
